items.message:
Monday evening's tide at 07:45 PM is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with westerly force 7 winds and large waves.
Areas most at risk include the coastline between Gore Point and Hurlstone Point including Porlock Weir.

The detailed tidal information for those who use it is for a peak level at Hinkley Point of 5.68 mAODN at 07:45 PM on 03/07/2023, which is 0.13 m above tide tables, with westerly force 7 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level - for more info refer to local tide tables.) All times are local and refer to high water time at Hinkley Point.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 04/07/2023, or as the situation changes.
